title_sort: reuben farwell to walt whitman, 16 august 1875
title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 16 August 1875
text: sent 2 papersAug 20, 1875Aug 16th 1875Dear Uncle WaltI received your Postal Card, but I was away to work when my wife received it.I have been 75 to 100 miles West of here working in the Harvest fieldsShe ought to have answered it before thisI am sorry that you do keep so miserable and feabel[feeble]I do hope by the time this reaches you that you are betterI hardly know what to write to you But I will say that we are well as commonI am going to California in November if the Lord will permit that my life may be sparedWalt I wish that I was abel[able] to come and take care of you how happy I would be to see your Dear face once moreGod bless youRuben[Reuben] FarwellNankin PoWayne CoMichMichiganWright[Write] soon Dear Uncle WaltaddressNankinWayne CoMichigan Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 16 August 1875
